header_summary:
Jeremy presents an innovative method for implementing Bitcoin covenants without altering the native protocol, utilizing covenant emulators and signing servers alongside a BitVM style fraud proof system to ensure compliance through financial penalties for breaches. This approach, detailed further in an online paper, proposes a novel solution to enforcing Bitcoin covenants, aiming to maintain protocol integrity while enhancing transaction rule adherence ([Read more](https://rubin.io/bitcoin/2024/11/26/unfed-covenants/)).

Ethan Heilman introduces slashing covenants as an alternative enforcement mechanism for Bitcoin transactions, which, unlike traditional methods, allow transactions but impose penalties for rule violations. This concept, leveraging Bitcoin script capabilities and Lamport signatures, suggests a less secure yet more compatible and efficient way to enforce transaction rules without the need for direct prevention, highlighting its potential ease of implementation on platforms like Ethereum ([Source](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/CAEM=y+V_jUoupVRBPqwzOQaUVNdJj5uJy3LK9JjD7ixuCYEt-A@mail.gmail.com/T/#u#m1f4795940901d29312dce1a4b763097ea5d9e7a6)).

Antoine Poinsot discusses the Consensus Cleanup proposal aimed at preventing duplicate coinbase transactions in the Bitcoin network by modifying transaction elements to distinguish future coinbase transactions. This initiative seeks to address BIP30 verification challenges and the limitations of Utreexo nodes in performing such validations, calling for feedback from the mining community to refine and implement viable solutions ([Further details](https://gnusha.org/pi/bitcoindev/cLJjA4Em1sfbLHBctwsPUvquk8uMGGnXt2zGx7mn_JNu5F-HULjtdsBQjX9VET6MVRhbzJExPRrwNKBeLV1S30uEgCtFiBmMPVuzTFVNxkY=@protonmail.com/T/#u#m3be1f9c3ae1faf45b543116ed9755eb6badcebbf)).

Lastly, discussions from Jonas and Jungly highlight ongoing efforts to reintegrate Lightning Network support within the Warnet framework and explore the operational differences between consensus mechanisms and Byzantine Fault Tolerance broadcasts in blockchain technology. These conversations underline significant technical strides and collaborative efforts within the community to enhance Bitcoin’s functionality and security, reflecting a collective pursuit of innovation and efficiency in blockchain systems.
